org.ensembl
Class Example

java.lang.Object
  org.ensembl.Example
public class Example
extends java.lang.Object

Example code demonstrating how to retrieve data from ensembl databases using ensj. The examples below retrieve data from the latest human core and variation databases on ensembldb.ensembl.org

Author:
Craig Melsopp
See Also:
Example.java source (txt)

          Creates an instance of Example with core and varition drivers configured.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws ConfigurationException,
                        AdaptorException,
                        java.text.ParseException
Prints some debug information before printing the output from the example methods in this class.

Parameters:
args - ignored.
Throws:
AdaptorException - if a problem occurs retrieving data
ConfigurationException - if a problem occurs initialising the driver(s)
java.text.ParseException - if a problem occurs parsing the string used to construct a location

fetchGeneByStableIDAndViewPeptide

public void fetchGeneByStableIDAndViewPeptide()
                                       throws AdaptorException
Fetch a gene by it's stable ID and then print the peptide corresponding to its first transcript.

Throws:
AdaptorException - if problem occurs during retrieval

fetchGenesByLocation

public void fetchGenesByLocation(Location location)
                          throws AdaptorException
This method illustrates several ways to retrieve genes from a specified location. With locations containing few genes the memory and speed differences between the methods will be small but for locations containing many genes the difference is potentially huge.

Parameters:
location - location to fetch genes from
Throws:
AdaptorException - if problem occurs during retrieval

fetchDeletedGeneFromArchive

public void fetchDeletedGeneFromArchive()
                                 throws AdaptorException
Fetches information about a gene from the archive.

Throws:
AdaptorException - if problem occurs during retrieval

fetchKaryotypes

public void fetchKaryotypes(CoordinateSystem coordinateSystem,
                            java.lang.String chromosomeName)
                     throws AdaptorException
Fetches information about karyotypes (chromosome bands) for the specified chromosome.

Parameters:
coordinateSystem - coordinate system containing the chromosomeName
chromosomeName - name of the chromosome of interest
Throws:
AdaptorException - if problem occurs during retrieval
